content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at approximately Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the production‐line components that handle copper conversion:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
• Burner inserter (direction RIGHT) at Position(3.5, 17.5)
• Burner inserter (direction DOWN) at Position(1.5, 17.5)
• Burner inserter (direction UP) at Position(2.5, 16.5)
• Assembling machine “assembling-machine-1” at Position(1.5, 19.5)
• Output chest at Position(1.5, 21.5)
• Additional burner inserter for output routing at Position(0.5, 21.5)

### Extraction Belt Depot at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Designed to serve as a dedicated belt target and buffer for the extraction system:
• Primary depot wooden chest at Position(3.5, 15.5)
• Adjacent transport belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5)
• Depot burner inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5)
• An additional isolated wooden chest (intended as an alternate belt target) at Position(–4.5, 18.5)

### Extraction System at Position(–3.5, 27.5)
Provides the resource extraction linkage:
• Extraction system burner inserter at Position(–3.5, 27.5) with drop position Position(–3.5, 28.5)
• Buffer chest at Position(–3.5, 26.5) supporting item transfer

### Smelting Facility near Positions (–3.0, 19.0) and (–4.0, 21.0)
Handles ore conversion processes:
• Stone furnace (producing iron-plate) at Position(–3.0, 19.0)
• Stone furnace (producing copper-plate) at Position(–4.0, 21.0)
• Associated collection chest at Position(–5.5, 21.5)

### Electricity Generator
Provides power production through steam-based components:
• Offshore pump at Position(–7.5, 25.5)
• Boiler at Position(–5.5, 24.0)
• Generator (steam-engine) at Position(–0.5, 24.5)
• Burner inserter feeding the power system at Position(–3.5, 23.5)

### Research Facility
Supports science production and technological progress:
• Laboratory (lab_input: {automation-science-pack: 17}, electrical_id: 7106)  
  (Position not specified)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────────
• Errors when connecting transport belts to invalid targets  
 – Several steps reported: “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object…”  
  Tip: Always verify that the transport belt’s target is a valid inserter (or equivalent input device) rather than a steam engine.

• Placement distance errors  
 – Error messages indicated inability to place a wooden chest because the target position (e.g. (3.5, 15.5)) was too far from the current player position.  
  Tip: Move closer to the target area before attempting placement to remain within the maximum allowed range.

• Inventory shortages  
 – An error was encountered when a wooden chest placement failed due to a lack of the item in inventory.  
  Tip: Confirm that all required items are available in the inventory prior to executing placement commands.

• Variable naming mistakes  
 – A NameError (“target_chest is not defined”) was thrown, suggesting an invalid variable reference.  
  Tip: Ensure that all target variables are correctly defined and referenced to avoid runtime naming errors.
